resources.title: Developing Inclusive Mobile Apps
resources.description: Building Accessible Apps for iOS andAndroid.

resources.title: Inclusive Design for a Digital World - Designingwith Accessibility in Mind
resources.description: What is inclusive design? It issimple. It means that your product has been created with the intention of being accessible to as manydifferent users as possible.

resources.title: Paste
resources.description: Design System for creating highquality, inclusive customer engagement experiences.

resources.title: Striking a Balance Between Native and CustomSelect Elements
resources.description: This “hybrid” select is anotherattempt to create a good looking select while getting as many native features as possible.

resources.title: Making information and the words we useaccessible
resources.description: The best way to find out how to makeinformation accessible is to ask the person or the people you will be giving the information to.

resources.title: Inclusive teaching - audio describing your ownpresentations
resources.description: Here’s some practical tips andexamples that show how some small changes in the language you use can make a significant difference forpeople in the audience that benefit from your descriptions of the visuals.

resources.title: WCAG easy!
resources.description: Understand once and for all how toproperly apply WCAG in your digital products.

resources.title: Mobile Accessibility - How to Build Apps thatWork for All Users
resources.description: On the web, we’ve made a lot ofprogress, and it’s generally accepted that accessibility is crucial in creating digital products thateveryone can use with ease. Mobile accessibility, on the other hand, is still fraught with problems.

resources.title: Typographic accessibility in more detail
resources.description: The three pillars of accessibility -emotional, functional and technical - can be applied to any output whether that is a product or a service.Each industry and sector will have its own specific definitions relevant to their output.

resources.title: Making Content Usable for People with Cognitiveand Learning Disabilities
resources.description: This document is for people who makeweb content (web pages) and web applications. It gives advice on how to make content usable for people withcognitive and learning disabilities.

resources.title: What is Inclusive Design, anyways?
resources.description: Inclusive Design is design thatconsiders the full range of human diversity with respect to ability, language, culture, gender, age andother forms of human difference.

resources.title: Eric Bailey's Blog
resources.description: Blog on accessible and inclusivedesign.

resources.title: Sarah Higley's Blog
resources.description: A collection ofaccessibility-focused articles.

resources.title: Fingerspelling
resources.description: Learn the ABC in American SignLanguage with machine learning.

resources.title: Scott O'Hara's Blog
resources.description: A collection of articles onaccessibility and UX.

resources.title: Digital Accessibility Experts Podcast by HassellInclusion
resources.description: Whether you call it Inclusive Designor Digital Accessibility, whether you're an individual with a passion or an organisation wanting to knowmore, this podcast explores a range of topics on accessibility. Hosted by Jonathan Hassell, its aim is toshare inspiration, expertise, and hints and tips to help speed you on your digital accessibility journey.

resources.title: Hassell Inclusion Blog
resources.description: Regular blogs from the HassellInclusion team on a range of topics from the strategic through to the more practical.

resources.title: Pixels vs. Relative Units in CSS - why it’s stilla big deal
resources.description: Long live the modern browser!Browsers are getting better these days. We seem to be in a golden age where there’s a never-ending stream ofnew features added for the benefit of the users accessing the page, and really great tools for thosecreating the page.

resources.title: Humane by Design
resources.description: A resource that provides guidancefor designing ethically humane digital products through patterns focused on user well-being.

resources.title: Accessible Form Fields
resources.description: A small figma component foraccessible form fields.

resources.title: Webflow accessibility
resources.description: Make your Webflow sites accessible.

resources.title: Opening Links in New Browser Windows and Tabs
resources.description: Carefully examine the user’scontext, task at hand, and next steps when deciding whether to open links to documents and external sites inthe same or a new browser tab.

resources.title: Editoria11y
resources.description: In many ways, Editoria11y is astopgap solution. Most of the mistakes it catches were made because we placed new expectations on contentauthors ('tag your content with good structure'), but gave them tools that encouraged the opposite.The path forward is to make accessible content creation easier, and as automatic as possible

resources.title: Manuel Matuzovic Blog
resources.description: Follow Manuel's blog for anyfront-end accessibility guides, tutorials, and resources.

resources.title: The 2020 State of Digital Accessibility ReportThe Education Sector
resources.description: This report is designed to be readas a companion to the 2020 State of Digital Accessibility Report (SODAR), published by Level Access incollaboration with G3ict and IAAP.

resources.title: Heading structures are tables of contents
resources.description: The heading structure of a web pageis like its table of contents. It gives people who can’t see your page a way to navigate it without readingeverything.

resources.title: Accessibility for teams
resources.description: Making your site more accessible canbe a daunting task. If you are approaching accessibility for the first time, the sheer breadth of the topiccan leave you wondering where to start.

resources.title: Digital Accessibility
resources.description: This course will help you tounderstand how those with sensory, physical and cognitive impairments may be disabled by barriersencountered when using digital technologies. The course will highlight how the use of accessible andinclusive design can help overcome many of these difficulties.

resources.title: Information and Communication Technology (ICT)Accessibility
resources.description: edx In this introductory course,learn how to measure an organization’s ICT accessibility and assess the importance of maintaining aninclusive workplace for both employees and customers with disabilities.

resources.title: Screen Reader Keyboard Shortcuts and Gestures
resources.description: List of screen reader keyboardshortcuts and gestures.

resources.title: Color Contrast Checker
resources.description: Evaluating your design for colorcontrast is a critical aspect of accessibility testing and organizations may benefit from appropriate userexperience training and expertise to ensure proper contrast.

resources.title: Applied Accessibility: Practical Tips forCreating more Accessible Front-Ends
resources.description: As front-end developers, we aretasked with building the front end of a Web site or application — in other words, we are building the user’send of an interface. This is why it is crucial that we ensure that the front-end foundations that we buildare as inclusive of and accessible to as many users as possible.

resources.title: Web Axe
resources.description: Blog and podcast on webaccessibility

resources.title: Accessible Components
resources.description: Listing of accessible components& patterns.

resources.title: Web Accessible Code Libraries and Design Patterns
resources.description: Within a web developmentorganization, it’s ideal to maintain (and enforce usage of) design patterns and a components library. Andthey should work together; design patterns create consistency among visual elements across projects and thecomponents library creates consistent implementation of those patterns during development.

resources.title: The Accessibility of Styled Form Controls
resources.description: A repository of styled and styled form control elements and markup patterns, and how they are announced by screen readers.

resources.title: Patterns – GOV.UK Design System
resources.description: gov-uk Patterns are best practicedesign solutions for specific user-focused tasks and page types.

resources.title: Components – GOV.UK Design System
resources.description: Components are reusable parts of theuser interface that have been made to support a variety of applications.

resources.title: Smashing Newsletter: Issue #289 —Useful librariesand case studies to get Accessibility just right
resources.description: Building accessible pages andapplications isn’t easy. We have to keep in mind how our sites and applications work with a keyboard alone,whether navigation landmarks are properly assigned, how updates are announced by a screen reader, andwhether we avoid any inaccessible libraries or third-party scripts. And then, for every component we arebuilding, we need to ensure that we keep them accessible over time.

resources.title: HBO Max adds key accessibility feature forvisually impaired users
resources.description: The service now offers audio descriptions for content, which describes what is happening on the screen beyond the dialog and soundeffects.This feature is joined by multiple other changes intended to improve accessibility.
